title: Starter: Raspberry Pi 5 AI Kit (8GB)
description: The Learning Curve. Runs tiny models (Phi-3, TinyLlama). Perfect for learning Linux and Python.

title: Entry Mac: Mac Mini M4 (16GB RAM)
description: The best value in AI right now. Runs 7B and 8B models (Llama-3, Mistral) incredibly fast and silent.

title: Pro Mac: Mac Mini M4 Pro (64GB RAM)
description: The 'Local Llama' Sweet Spot. 64GB Unified Memory lets you run 70B parameter models comfortably.

title: The Beast: Mac Studio M2 Ultra (192GB)
description: Enterprise Grade. The only consumer hardware that can run massive 120B+ models (Grok, Llama-3-400B) entirely in RAM.

title: PC Build: Budget King (Used RTX 3090)
description: High risk, high reward. 24GB VRAM for cheap. Requires building a PC around a used GPU.

title: PC Build: The Gamer (RTX 4090 24GB)
description: Maximum Speed. The fastest inference you can get for a home lab. Great for image generation (Flux, SDXL).

title: Server: Used Dell R730 (Tesla P40)
description: The Loud Option. Enterprise rack server. Noisy, power hungry, but 24GB VRAM for very cheap.

title: Tiny PC: Minisforum UM790 (64GB RAM)
description: The Mac Alternative. Small, silent, x86 Windows/Linux box. Good for mid-sized models.
